Set.Text: Newly founded Cities start with +1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population. Bonus increases to +2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population if the City is settled adjacent to a River.

Row.Text: Sumer Faith Dummy
Sumer Interface Dummy
Summer Decision Dummy
Summer Wheat Dummy

The Abgal are seven Sumerian sages, demigods who are said to have been created by the god Enki to establish culture and give civilization to mankind. They served as priests of Enki and as advisors or sages to the earliest rulers of Sumer before the flood. They are credited with giving mankind the Me (moral code), the crafts, and the arts. They were seen as fish-like men who emerged from the sweet water Abzu. They are commonly represented as having the lower torso of a fish, or dressed as a fish.
This building cannot be constructed but rather facilitates Sumer's unique abilities.
+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith from Specialists in this City.

The Ziggurat is the Sumerian unique building, replacing the Temple. Its primarily benefit is in providing one Scientist Specialist slot. Additionally, all Specialists within the City will also generate [ICON_PEACE] Faith once the Ziggurat is constructed.
